result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martesse Antonio Johnson

records.addlTxt:
per email from Defense Counsel requesting this case be placed on the speedy disposition calendar before Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Branch 37 notified and confirmed hearing date. New date confirmed with both parties. 
Case placed on Branch 37 calendar for a Plea and Sentencing November 17, 2022 at 2:00pm.

ADOURNED OFF THE RECORD. 
Defendant Martesse A Johnson not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Martesse A Johnson. 
 Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case calendared for a Plea and Sentencing Hearing.
Defense counsel request an adjournment. Granted by the Court. 
Case remans calendared in Branch 19 and ordered matter adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant Martesse A Johnson not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has received discovery and an offer and is requesting a plea and sentencing date.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Martesse Antonio Johnson in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Martesse Antonio Johnson in custody.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Martesse Antonio Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/24/2022@2:30p
